caption:
This photograph depicts a large-scale mining operation in a rugged, barren landscape. Dominating the scene is a massive mining machine, possibly a dragline excavator, with a large boom and bucket system used for strip mining. The machine, which is predominantly beige, is positioned across a deep cut into the earth, which reveals dark, possibly coal-rich soil.

The excavator stands over a black pathway that looks freshly carved, likely a road for haul trucks, which transport excavated material from the site. In the foreground, there are two trucks on this road; one is white and the other is brown, both with visible dirt marks, indicating frequent usage in the harsh conditions.

The surrounding landscape is quite arid and rocky, with minimal vegetation, characterized by various shades of gray and brown earth that form the backdrop. The terrain is uneven, with piles of rubble and gravel around, a testament to the ongoing excavation work.

The overall mood of the image feels industrious and a bit desolate, highlighting the scale and impact of human industrial activity on natural landscapes. There are no visible people in the image, emphasizing the focus on machinery and the environment.
title: Hugh strip mining machinery in operation near dunfermline in fulton county.  Fulton county has been, and is, a center for strip mining in the state
